title: test_openssl_assert_error_on_stack fails with OpenSSL 3.0.1 FIPS
body:
The test case ``test_openssl_assert_error_on_stack`` fails with ``openssl-3.0.1-5.el9.x86_64`` on C9S on a FIPS enabled system. My guess is FIPS provider changes the error code from invalid block length to generic FIPS ``digital envelope routines::unsupported`` error code:

```
self = <test_openssl.TestOpenSSL object at 0x7f3eb5d8e880>

    def test_openssl_assert_error_on_stack(self):
        b = Binding()
        b.lib.ERR_put_error(
            b.lib.ERR_LIB_EVP,
            b.lib.EVP_F_EVP_ENCRYPTFINAL_EX,
            b.lib.EVP_R_DATA_NOT_MULTIPLE_OF_BLOCK_LENGTH,
            b"",
            -1,
        )
        with pytest.raises(InternalError) as exc_info:
            _openssl_assert(b.lib, False)
    
        error = exc_info.value.err_code[0]
        # BoringSSL has completely different error codes, so we just skip
        # these assertinos.
        if not b.lib.CRYPTOGRAPHY_IS_BORINGSSL:
            # As of 3.0.0 OpenSSL no longer sets func codes (which we now also
            # ignore), so the combined code is a different value.
>           assert error.code in (101183626, 50331786)
E           AssertionError: assert 50856204 in (101183626, 50331786)
E            +  where 50856204 = _OpenSSLErrorWithText(code=50856204, lib=6, reason=524556, reason_text=b'error:0308010C:digital envelope routines::unsupported').code

tests/hazmat/bindings/test_openssl.py:105: AssertionError
```
